DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Giving St. John 's wort may effective relieve fatigue patient cancer undergo chemotherapy hormone therapy . PURPOSE : Randomized phase III trial determine effectiveness St. John 's wort relieve fatigue patient undergo chemotherapy hormone therapy cancer .
DOC.brief_title: St. John 's Wort Relieving Fatigue Patients Undergoing Chemotherapy Hormone Therapy Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine efficacy Hypericum perforatum ( St. John 's Wort ) relieve fatigue patient undergo chemotherapy hormonal therapy malignant disease . II . Determine relationship fatigue , depression , anxiety patient . III . Determine correlation quality sleep level fatigue patient . OUTLINE : This randomize , placebo control study . Patients randomize one two treatment arm . Arm I : Patients receive oral Hypericum perforatum ( St. John 's Wort ) 3 time day . Arm II : Patients receive oral placebo 3 time day . Treatment continue 6 week absence worsen symptom unacceptable toxicity . Patients complete Profile Mood States ( POMS ) Brief Fatigue Inventory begin end study . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 220 patient ( 110 per arm ) accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Patients malignant disease receive chemotherapy regimen least 6 week less 6 month , continue concurrent chemotherapy least 34 week OR Patients malignant disease receive hormonal therapy least 3 month prior study , continue entire study Profile Mood States ( POMS ) Fatigue Subscale score 14 high POMS Depression Subscale score 13 less PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : Over 17 Performance status : Karnofsky 70100 % Life expectancy : At least 3 month Hematopoietic : Hemoglobin least 10 g/dL No decline hemoglobin 2 g/dL one month prior study Hematocrit least 30 % Hepatic : SGOT great 3 time upper limit normal Bilirubin le 2.0 mg/dL Renal : Creatinine great 2.0 mg/dL OR Creatinine clearance least 60 mL/min Cardiovascular : No unstable cardiac disease Pulmonary : No debilitate pulmonary disease Other : No uncontrolled pain No uncontrolled serious infection No significant comorbidity would preclude study participation Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : Not specify Chemotherapy : See Disease Characteristics Endocrine therapy : See Disease Characteristics Radiotherapy : Not specify Surgery : Not specify Other : At least 1 month since prior Hypericum perforatum ( St. John 's Wort ) No concurrent St. John 's Wort No concurrent monamine oxidase inhibitor ( e.g. , furazolidone , isocarboxazid , meclobremide , phenelzine , procarbazine , selegiline , tranylcypromine ) No concurrent sympathomimetic amine ( e.g. , amphetamine , phenylpropanolamine , pseudoephedrine ) stimulant methylphenidate No concurrent serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( e.g. , fluoxetine , paroxetine , sertraline , venlafaxine , nefazodone , mirtazepine , buspirone , trazodone ) tricyclic antidepressant ( e.g. , amitriptyline , clomipramine , desipramine , doxepin , imipramine , nortriptyline , protriptyline ) No concurrent serotonergic agent ( e.g. , lithium , meperidine , dextromethorphan ) No concurrent active treatment anemia ( e.g. , transfusion epoetin alpha )
